item.title: Addict offered 14yo girl drugs for sex
item.description: A drug addict offered a vulnerable 14-year-old girl cocaine in exchange for sexual favours at Melbourne’s iconic Flinders Street Station.

item.title: ‘Suspicious’ sighting before shooting
item.description: A Mercedes used as a getaway car in the gangland execution of Mahmoud ‘Mick’ Hawi aroused the suspicions of a woman just minutes before the bikie boss was gunned down.

item.title: Barnesy’s essential tip on handling lockdown
item.description: Locked down but not beaten, Melbourne residents are being invited to stand on their front porch and let out a collective scream on Friday.

item.title: Thorn throws his arms around Petaia
item.description: Brad Thorn knows the devastation of losing a father at a young age.

item.title: ‘Devastating’: Flight Centre warns of massive loss
item.description: Troubled travel group Flight Centre has warned investors of a multi-million-dollar loss ahead of its financial results, flagging the coronavirus pandemic is still inflicting pain upon the tourism-dependent business.

item.title: ‘Sex’ teacher: What CCTV allegedly shows
item.description: A western Sydney high school teacher was “foolish” in meeting up with a 14-year-old male student outside school hours, but denies allegations she repeatedly sexually assaulted him, a court has heard.

item.title: Penrith’s battle to retain young stars
item.description: Penrith coach Ivan Cleary concedes the Panthers could “potentially” lose some young players due to the club’s salary cap.

item.title: Drastic move to control virus outbreaks
item.description: The state has taken over three Melbourne nursing homes as volatile coronavirus outbreaks continue to wreak havoc in Victorian aged-care facilities.

item.title: ‘One person puts all at risk’: top cop
item.description: The man who absconded from a Toowoomba motel during his mandatory hotel quarantine had already been fined for providing police with false information at the border.

item.title: Carer on manslaughter bailed to babysit
item.description: The carer charged over the manslaughter of Adelaide woman Ann Smith, who police said died in “disgusting and degrading circumstances”, has been granted home detention bail.
